abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column observes that New York Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver, who has shown little mercy to fellow public figures facing political troubles, is now standing firmly on the principle of presumption of innocence for himself; calls Silver's disregard for ethical conduct breathtaking in face of criminal complaints revealing upwards of $4 million in illegal payments.
lead_paragraph: In the past, Sheldon Silver, the New York State Assembly speaker who now faces graft charges, has rarely given quarter to other powerful people in distress.

byline.contributor:
Reporting on the arrest of
Speaker Sheldon Silver was
contributed by Charles V.
Bagli, Russ Buettner, David
W. Chen, Sandra E. Garcia,
Colin Moynihan, Benjamin
Mueller, Sarah Maslin Nir,
Nikita Stewart and Benjamin
Weiser, and research by
Susan C. Beachy.

snippet: In the past, Sheldon Silver, the New York State Assembly speaker who now faces graft charges, has rarely given quarter to other powerful people in distress.

headline.main: An Albany Powerhouse on the Edge of a Volcano
headline.seo: Sheldon Silver, a Self-Proclaimed Champion of Disclosure, Now Faces Corruption Charges
headline.print_headline: An Albany Powerhouse on the Edge of a Volcano
